cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 mi SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then curving northwest and slowing as it approaches the North Carolina–South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: vicinity of Cape Fear to Myrtle Beach area (NC/SC border region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm-surge warning for the same stretch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Portions of the South and North Carolina coasts and the Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: 20–35 mph sustained winds with higher gusts possible late Friday into Saturday as Florence passes well north of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast because surge guidance keeps impacts north of Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of occasional heavy showers possible; widespread flooding not expected at Brunswick
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Georgia beaches beginning Thursday and persisting into the weekend
